Player History
Had first career hit on 4/3/1985, off Eric Show (SD)...
Hit first career homerun on 4/14/1985, off Larry Andersen (PHI)...
Won Player of the Week award on 5/15/1985, hitting .520 with 1 HR, 8 RBI...
Was selected to the 1985 Allstar game...
Had 26-game hitting streak snapped on 7/14/1985...
Won Gold Glove Award at Centerfield in 1985...
2/2/1986: Gets a new one-year contract worth $8,260,000 through salary arbitration...
Won Batter of the Month award on 10/1/1986, hitting .425 with 2 HR, 17 RBI...
2/2/1987: Gets a new one-year contract worth $8,260,000 through salary arbitration...
Was selected to the 1987 Allstar game...
Won Player of the Week award on 7/17/1987, hitting .563 with 0 HR, 5 RBI...
Had 20-game hitting streak snapped on 7/23/1987...
Signed as a free agent by Atlanta on 2/8/1988 to a 4-year deal worth $9,872,200 per year...
Won Player of the Week award on 6/5/1988, hitting .643 with 1 HR, 3 RBI...
Was selected to the 1988 Allstar game...
Won Gold Glove Award at Centerfield in 1988...
Had 5 hits with 5 RBI against St. Louis on 6/13/1989...
Was selected to the 1989 Allstar game...
Won Gold Glove Award at Centerfield in 1989...
Had 5 hits with 0 RBI against Cincinnati on 4/21/1990...
Traded from Atlanta to Seattle on 6/9/1990 (Going to ATL: LF Darryl Motley. Going to SEA: CF Willie McGee, P Frank Rodriguez, P Anthony Telford)...
Signed as a free agent by San Diego on 2/17/1992 to a 1-year deal worth $9,175,000 per year...
